summary: This is a Questionnaire and Release form for potential claimants in the class action settlement of Jane Doe 1 v. JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A., related to Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking venture. It provides instructions for victims to submit claims for compensation from the settlement fund, outlines the claims process, and includes a detailed release of claims against JPMorgan Chase.

persons.name: Jane Doe 1
persons.context: Named plaintiff in the class action lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase Bank, representing herself and all others similarly situated as victims of Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking venture.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the case, identified as the perpetrator of sexual abuse and trafficking against the claimants. The questionnaire asks about interactions with him and his associates.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Trained assistant available to help claimants fill out the questionnaire and answer questions about the process. She is described as trained in assisting survivors of sexual trauma.

persons.name: Simone Lelchuk
persons.context: Administrator responsible for determining settlement amounts for claimants. She may request meetings with claimants and reviews all submitted information.

connections.description: Jane Doe 1 is a victim-survivor of sexual abuse and/or trafficking by Jeffrey Epstein, as outlined in the class action lawsuit.
Brittany Henderson provides assistance to Jane Doe 1 and other class members in completing the settlement questionnaire as part of Class Counsel.
Simone Lelchuk serves as the Claims Administrator who will evaluate Jane Doe 1's claim and determine her settlement allocation.

events.title: Settlement Stipulation Signed
events.description: Stipulation of Settlement dated June 22, 2023, establishing the terms of the class action settlement between Jane Doe 1 and JPMorgan Chase Bank.

events.title: Opt-Out Deadline
events.description: Deadline for class members to submit Opt-Out Forms if they wish to be excluded from the settlement and preserve their claims.

events.title: Questionnaire Submission Deadline
events.description: Final deadline for claimants to submit completed Questionnaire and Release forms to participate in the settlement.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: This document is part of a class action settlement (Jane Doe 1 v. JPMorgan Chase Bank) where victims of Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking can submit claims for compensation.
The Claims Administrator, Simone Lelchuk, determines settlement amounts based on factors including severity of abuse, relationship with Epstein, and impact on the claimant.
Claimants must describe their experiences with Epstein including meeting circumstances, locations of abuse, number of incidents, witnesses, and impact.
The settlement releases claims against JPMorgan Chase Bank and related parties but preserves claims against other entities like Deutsche Bank in a separate case.
The document includes detailed confidentiality provisions and a comprehensive legal release waiving unknown claims under laws similar to California Civil Code ยง 1542.
